pullRequest.body:
According to the comment, these instances should be removed now that https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/issues/2522 has been closed.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [6af4c84288](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20691/commits/6af4c84288b945a7e04b6dd0de871ae0c5cedb00)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.NormPow | 1925 | 1918 | -7 (-0.36%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.NormPow`|-7|

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`- instance : NormedSpace ùïú (Dual ùïú E) := inferInstance`
`- instance : SeminormedAddCommGroup (Dual ùïú E) := inferInstance`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Removing `instance : SeminormedAddCommGroup (Dual ùïú E)` still fails with:
```
Dual.lean:191:4
type mismatch
  LinearMap.zero_mem_polar (dualPairing ùïú E).flip ?m.109490
has type
  0 ‚àà (dualPairing ùïú E).flip.polar ?m.109490 : Prop
but is expected to have type
  0 ‚Ä¢ x' ‚àà polar ùïú s : Prop
```
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/8b10e614-7df0-4bf6-8d83-6187882b46ce) for commit 87470d48b5869968fac89d76dc015467ed59d93a.
There were [significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/2a3db524-6e2d-4220-b29e-04095781a426/to/8b10e614-7df0-4bf6-8d83-6187882b46ce) against commit 73658685379287b6f21116441a34f6e08bfdac0b:
```diff
  Benchmark                                         Metric         Change
  =======================================================================
- ~Mathlib.Analysis.Fourier.FourierTransformDeriv   instructions     8.4%
```

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|+33.791‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+0.02%)|
|`Mathlib.Analysis.Fourier.FourierTransformDeriv`|+28.682‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+8.41%)|
|`Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Module.Dual`|+5.483‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+9.10%)|
|`Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.NormPow`|+2.134‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+5.27%)|
<details><summary>2 files, Instructions +1.0‚¨ù10‚Åπ</summary>

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.Dual`|+1.430‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+2.92%)|
|`Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.Adjoint`|+1.65‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+0.49%)|
</details>

[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12958749566)
@sgouezel what are your thoughts here now?
See https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/set_option.20maxSynthPendingDepth.202
My hot take: helper instances are cool, they make mathlib faster, so we shouldn't merge this. What do others think?
Once we bump `maxSynthPendingDepth`, I see no reason to keep the instances: they will clutter instance search, for no gain.
!bench
Can you merge master, and then remove all the lines about `maxSynthPendingDepth` as it has been set to 3 in master, to avoid situations like these ones?

Could you also remove the other one? You will need to add
```
set_option maxSynthPendingDepth 2 in
```
just before `theorem smul_mem_polar`

pullRequest.title: chore(Analysis/Normed/Module/Dual): remove temporary instance
